channel.title: HACL on Cryspen
channel.description: Recent content in HACL on Cryspen

item.title: HACL
item.description: HACL is a set of formally verified cryptographic libraries in C, JavaScript, OCaml, and Rust. The libraries are based on the HACL* research project, originally developed by Inria and Microsoft Research.

item.title: libcrux
item.description: Libcrux is a formally verified cryptographic library that brings together verified artifacts from different sources. It uses hacspec as a common language for the specifications underlying the correctness and security proofs.

item.title: HACL Packages v0.6
item.description: Today, we announce the first release of the HACL Packages libraries. ðŸŽ‰ This release of HACL packages includes the first release of the HACL C library and a new release of the hacl-star OCaml bindings.

item.title: HACL Packages
item.description: Earlier this year, Tezos and Nomadic Labs started to work with Cryspen to improve HACL* and ensure that it is a viable long-term solution for Tezos' cryptographic needs.
